title: Sustaining Team Performance
content: Team performance isn't static—it requires ongoing maintenance. Relationships need investment. Skills need practice. Trust needs reinforcement. Teams that assume past performance guarantees future results find themselves degrading. Sustained performance requires sustained attention.

mcq.question: A high-performing team has been working well for months. Performance starts declining. What's likely happening?

options.B: The team needs renewed investment in practices that enabled performance

mcq.explanation: Team effectiveness erodes without maintenance. Practices that built performance—communication, trust-building, coordination—need ongoing investment. Complacency is a symptom; the cause is assuming performance maintains itself.

openQuestions: What maintains your team's performance over time?
Where has past team performance degraded, and why?
